Key Match Events: James Rodriguez scored one goal and set up another as Colombia overcame Argentina 2-1.
Yerson Mosquera put Colombia ahead with a close-range header after Rodriguez's cross.
Nico Gonzalez equalized for Argentina by intercepting a pass and scoring.
Rodriguez converted a penalty after Daniel Munoz was brought down by Nicolas Otamendi.
Post-Match Reflections: James Rodriguez commented on the tough conditions and expressed satisfaction with the fair result.
Rodriguez has now scored or assisted 10 times in his past eight international appearances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result lifted Colombia to second in the South American zone standings with 16 points from eight qualifiers, two points behind leaders Argentina.
